resources.string: A broad, verdant valley surrounded by mountains and is one of the most popular destinations in the Great Smokies.
A variety of historic buildings have been preserved in the valley.
At 6,643 feet, Clingmans Dome is the highest point in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.
An exuberant mountain stream gave this area its unusual name.
Modern lodging with a multi-tiered indoor pool and a rustic restaurant, plus a mountain-view deck.
Modern rooms and suites in an informal hotel featuring an indoor pool, a restaurant and a fitness room.
Unfussy hotel with casual rooms, plus an indoor pool, a fitness center and free hot breakfast.
Relaxed hotel offering an outdoor pool, plus unassuming rooms with free Wi-Fi and private balconies.
Automobile archive featuring famous film and TV cars including the General Lee and 1966 Batmobile.
Quirky museum featuring salt and pepper shakers from various eras made from a range of materials.
Rustic, cabin-themed eatery offering modern takes on classic Southern breakfast dishes.
Rustic restaurant serves many varieties of flapjacks and crÃªpes for breakfast and a hot buffet at lunch.
A gabled slate roof tops this popular breakfast and lunch spot, known for many varieties of flapjacks.
Low-key daytime joint serving up ample portions of American breakfast and lunch classics.
